column5: That is a monster!!  I see 7.24 on that scale though..  May I be so bold as to ask why the photo opp of that speck was taken on shore and not on the boat?  Those colours would have been way more vivid, especially the blue halos..  Thing looks like it's been dispatched for a while.  That lake is a gem though..  I'm sure I don't need to remind you of your responsibilities when it comes to fishing a place like that.  cheers HD

Highdrift....  We went to shore because all hell had broken loose ,, The fish was bleeding like a stuck pig , both my thumbs were bleeding like hell ,, from my partners yelling grab it , grab it   :devil:   Next outing I would like Leechman to get a Beast like that...   I might have the fish mounted or lop it in the Garden for fertilizer....   :unsure:      :wacko:
man I would kill for a fish like that but no fish in Ontario would touch that first lure......LOL
Awesome report dude!!!! Looks like you guys had an amazing day on the water forsure sweet lookin SPEC.............
Wow amazing speck!!!!! Good job and for sure square tail and blue halos.
JINX!!! lol  Yup...thats the way it's supposed to happen.....WELL done boys...keep at er!!!!
I think highdrift wants you to keep the name and location of the lake to yourselves to avoid ruining what appears to be an awesome fishery.
Fish of a life time!  great job!  keep those reports coming!  and if you get a mount done, let us see the results!
amazing-congrats
no ''IF''  HE MUST.....  put that on the wall....  im willing to pay half of the cost..... knowing i was the guy who drove the boat to this BRUTE!
I am in awe ... one word ... WOW !  Thanks for sharing ... I am scheduled to head towards my favourite ZEC this Thursday .. I may not sleep again until then
SPEECHLESS  That will be a hard one to beat hein Paul Hope you have a big open area on one of the walls in the living room for this one Great job you guys Jacques
Whoa Paul what a hog man.thanks for the report
Amazing fish! You guys definitely have a gem there, keep it inder your hat.
incredible!
amazing guys!! little question..i dont mean to start a debate but do you guys keep all trophys or let some go?
All it would take , would be the wrong type of guy to find out about this Lake ...and all hell would brake loose  :(  :(  :devil:

No problem there .....   Many fish are released ,, My first reaction was to get the fish in question back in the water and released but unfortunately is was bleeding bad   Looking back now I could ..  :wallbash:  :wallbash:      for being unprepared..
i hear ya..them brookies are so fragile....keep them coming!
Mon Dieu!!
nice fish great scenary thanks for sharing

tell me OH GREAT PREDITOR you are.  how are you supposed to ''get ready''  you knew you were oging to catch a fish that size that day???  what would you have done different?  what do you MEAN '' UNPREPARED''.  to me we were as ready as anyone could have been.  what you mean is.  you shouldnt have left your brain at home befor going fishing that day.
What I should have at home ,was the 250lb Moose we brought along with us..

Well Ladies and Gents...  Days like today are pretty much unpredictable , A couple of us headed out in search of some Big Bad Trout , And Man did we get Lucky.  Long story short, here's some pics ......  24/7 with a Quebec Red Beauty....    He caught with a Quebec Blue...    Action shots.....      Now Bass- Hunter's turn    Nature Shots           Now for the Freak.....  :worthy:         OFC  Style of pic....        What a Day Today....  :wub:
My oh my.. that is some awesome fish.... on the last one the " freak"... i do not see any blue rings on the red specks... is it a splake? Either way they are some top fish.. well done matey
Wow!!!!
First pic clearly shows blue rings on red specks.

MY OH MY.... Whitespinnerbait cuts the report WITHOUT the details..................  we get to the ''PLACE'' in question at very early .... what we dont know is that we need to tow my alum. boat.....  OK we were three guys... my alum..... is NOT light...  + elec motor + 80 lbs baterries... we had 2.........+ all the usual lugage..............  we get to the fist lake where RYAN got his 4.5.....its all fun in games... i get the first speck...  Whitespinnerbait pulls out a 20 $ MINI SPECK NET.....to net my fish... :?    VERY BAD idea....... my lure get hook into the net and the speck released itsself.... :x  twas a nice 2 lbs for sure.....  well lets call it a nice C & R !  get around the lake and i cast near a fallen birch tree..... i had my polarized glass'S X RAY VISION STYLE!  i see 2 speck fighting for my lure....... yet 0 bites... im like ok thats nice....  continue the first round then i get a big hit... well the speck SMASHED my lure i go to set the hook..... pulled the lure out of his mouth....  im like................ :roll:  2 -3 rounds around the lake and its seems like the prime was in the mornning..... we ''heard'' by locals that there was another lake over the mountains.....  OVER... the moutains........  we are like LETS DO IT BABY!!!!  pays of big time as we all know ba hooked into somehting he though didnt exist......  a................... true...............FREAK      funny thing is that befor hitting this fish he said....  ''quote''  this erea is the type of structure where a seriouse beast would swim around...... ''unquote''  not a minute later he hits the speck of his life....  well THE OLD MAN  deserve this fish ....  i hope that ill be able to work as hard and be as determined as his is at his age.......  congrats paul and i realy hope you decide to put that fish on the wall becasue that fish isnt only HUGE and AWESOME...  but hold a great fishermans story....  24/7      NOTE: couple more pictures of the day   other angle of ryans  fish    my quebec red! i like this picture cause of the COLORS!!!    greenish!  :  after getting the ''FREAK'' on shore for a foto session... the fish lost weight... its must have spit out at least 10- 12 minnows....    LIVE ones....  and last but not least... you cant argue against ''THE DIGITAL SCALE OF TRUTHFULLNESS''    7.24........................+ a dozen minnows.........7.4!
Nice fish gentlemen. Great nature shots as well. That big snapper looks ornery. Last couple look like splake to me too.
What a Monster! Well Done!  Nice Squaretail for sure. Take tons of pictures so they get the colours right on the mount!  K
Nice fish and pic's. Well done.

Fair enough.. i can't see any... splake can have slight blue rings but i don't see the tell tail halo effect on the last one. So bloody hard to tell them apart at the best of times... i am still droolin over the fish to pay much attention anyways.
Easiest way to tell.....every splake I've seen no matter how many times it was back-crossed had a fork tail.  They all look the same on the BBQ.  I need a new keyboard...this one's soaked
Wow that is a beauty for sure  Congrats Whitespinnerbait
you must have spilled your drink on it or something like that..  If you maximize the pics the blue and red is really clear
WOW. WHAT A TROPHY. CONGRATS BRO
Holy Smokes!!!  What a beaut  Joey
ever seen a splake with a squaretail???  these are pure specks no dought about it!  0 splake in that lake
I just realized i've been admiring those pics for almost an hour!  Speck of a lifetime!

Paul and a big fish???  .. PHOTOSHOP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!      ... nice story boyz.. but I aint buying it!!!   ... had it been Stephanie that caught the fish..
awesome guys....lol...brkygtr and myself were out today for specks, 7hrs of trying and nothing!
here is a short video of the ''FREAK'' getting netted..... AWESOME job form my cousin BTW!
I dunno, still looks like Paul posing with Stephanies fish to me....   ... we all know that Stephanie is HOT!!!... and Paul is NOT!!!
my girl friend is laughing SOOOO hard right now!
wow! congrats!
What a brute WTG, the others are also respectable as well, good stuff...
I would be happy catching any of those specks. Great fish guys! That is a true giant. What else do you guys use other than spoons and spinners?
Mepps Black Fury #2 ,,,Gulp Alive ,,,Little Mepps Spoons .  :worthy:   That's about it right there.............
